column1: When the pandemic hit I worked closely with Governor DeWine to save lives. I led the charge in Congress to secure more than $100 billion dollars for hospitals ensured medical workers had critical supplies to stay safe and voted to make coronavirus testing free. https://t.co/e3GqgnqImD

I am a firm believer in bipartisanship and compromise. Last week the Problem Solvers Caucus proposed a new coronavirus relief package. Congress needs to put party aside and take action to help struggling families overcome the challenges of this pandemic. https://t.co/gpIMSSqVZi

Great conversations at the first-ever Punjabi-Americans for Dave coalition roundtable. These healthcare and business leaders discussed how COVID-19 has affected their communities and how Congress can continue to provide support. I’m proud to have them in my corner this election. https://t.co/YEnJrns2c2

The News Herald editorial board applauded my efforts urging House leadership to pass comprehensive opioid legislation. As overdoses skyrocket during COVID-19 Congress must move quickly to pass my legislation the COPE Act to help battle this epidemic. https://t.co/KBk9L5LiJo

Thank you @realdonaldtrump for signing my bill the Safeguarding America’s First Responders Act of 2020 into law. This critical legislation guarantees financial security to the families of our heroic first responders battling COVID-19 on the frontlines. https://t.co/kjW3XljZfn

The opioid epidemic has ravaged our communities and COVID-19 has only made the problem worse. Everyday Congress refuses to act more people suffer. I’m calling on Speaker Pelosi to bring my bill the COPE Act to a vote ASAP. https://t.co/A8G0ZX8wNi

Thank you to members of @NATCA in NE Ohio for joining me on a virtual discussion and helping #TeamJoyce make thousands of phone calls to voters. Air traffic controllers remain essential during COVID and continue to keep our skies safe for commercial flights and cargo deliveries. https://t.co/6vMHw5PfJU

Many public service workers have been laid-off or furloughed due to the coronavirus pandemic. Their student loan forgiveness should not be put at risk provided they re-enter public service after the pandemic. Read more about my legislation below ⬇️ https://t.co/KZMtxs7P7W

.@MikeDeWine has extended the restrictions on mass gatherings and issued a new health order on other social distancing rules for businesses. Please read below for more information or visit https://t.co/9v3N6hay0v for up-to-date coronavirus information. https://t.co/4ndlmTrceP

Proud to join members of both parties from Ohio’s congressional delegation in supporting legislation to help our hospital systems that have suffered financially due to coronavirus. Our hospitals must have the resources to continue providing quality care. https://t.co/62RAfGFwar

I recently joined a virtual meeting with @OhioChildHosp to hear about the impact COVID-19 has had on children’s hospitals. As co-chair of the House Nursing Caucus I will continue to make sure hospitals receive the resources needed to provide quality care. https://t.co/jORjoNgq8k

The risk for domestic abuse has substantially increased during COVID-19. However the opportunity for students to report abuse to educators has drastically decreased due to the nature of remote learning. Online platforms must adapt to give students an opportunity to report abuse. https://t.co/KJiuXJao2f

Child abuse reports have dropped 50% since the COVID pandemic began. Last week I sent a letter to @BetsyDeVosED urging the @usedgov to make sure students who are at risk of abuse at home can still report these cases and get help from proper authorities. https://t.co/7747SbiF5J

Earlier this month I sent a letter to President Trump asking the Administration to continue to make resources available to mitigate the detrimental impact COVID-19 has had on our ability to combat the opioid crisis. https://t.co/TMzATt6jrS

In Ohio we all know someone who has been touched by the opioid epidemic. Unfortunately new stressors caused by COVID-19 threaten to fuel the next wave of the opioid crisis. That’s why bipartisan legislation to provide more funding for law enforcement and treatment is critical. https://t.co/cGZe92rMJZ

This #MilitaryAppreciationMonth we salute our veterans and active men and women in uniform for their bravery and self-sacrifice.  I’m glad the CARES Act secured nearly $20 billion to help our nation’s veterans during COVID-19 but there’s more to do. https://t.co/iyaFAVGOpJ

I’m working hard to provide bipartisan solutions to save lives and livelihoods. I helped secure $25 billion for COVID-19 testing and $40 million for Ohio’s hospitals and healthcare systems. I’m working with @MikeDeWine to safely reopen our economy and get Ohioans back to work. https://t.co/KrW8oK48wD

The coronavirus is a public health crisis. Republicans and Democrats need to return to Washington to continue the work of the American people and support our families small businesses owners and health care heroes. https://t.co/RqvhUjUa8T

We cannot allow COVID-19 to fuel the next wave of the opioid crisis. In Congress I have fought for bipartisan solutions to end the opioid epidemic and voted to increase funding for treatment and resources. We’ve made great progress and we can’t stop now. https://t.co/Fvdbm2JCXe
What do you think of the @Browns new uniforms? 🔥🔥 All team proceeds will be going towards the team’s Hats Off to Our Heroes program to fund COVID-19 relief efforts. https://t.co/dwJhS829qy

Today is #WorldHealthDay. Let’s all take a moment to thank our doctors nurses researchers scientists and public health officials who are working around the clock to defeat COVID-19 and keep the American people informed. https://t.co/o8py5h7aOx

My first priority is the health and safety of #OH14 families. I will continue to work with members of both parties to help our Ohio families stay informed and have the resources we need to combat #COVID19. We are #InThisTogetherOhio. https://t.co/lsQn5soF9Y

🚨 Small businesses can start applying for the @SBA Paycheck Protection Program TODAY. This loan will help employers keep their workforce during #COVID19 and can be forgiven if employees are kept on payroll for 8 weeks. Learn more here: https://t.co/WHMTK6ri3V
This year’s #NationalDoctorsDay comes at a time with new meaning. Thank you to all of our incredible doctors on the frontlines of the #COVID19 crisis. You are all true heroes. https://t.co/91hEvxCn6M

I joined colleagues on both sides of the aisle to advocate for funding to help Americans suffering from #COVID19. OH is a prime location to ramp up R&D.  We stand ready to work with the WH COVID-19 Task Force to ensure we have the tools to end this crisis. https://t.co/1r3GFK3PG8

Yesterday I joined Bill Wills on WTAM to discuss COVID-19.  It is important to stay informed on the facts about the disease and how we can help prevent it from spreading further into our communities.  If you have any questions regarding COVID-19 go to https://t.co/9v3N6hay0v https://t.co/OMnjXqqeHP
